name: heat production, at hard coal industrial furnace 1-10MW | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3974/documentation

This dataset represents the production of heat from a 1-10 MW hard coal industrial furnace filled with 1 MJ of egg coal. The stoker-boiler furnace fires egg coals with hard coal quality between long-flame coal and fat coal. As there is no module for egg coal, the hard coal supply mix is used. The lifetime of the furnace is 20 years, which corresponds to 5000 fully load hours per year. The heating value is 28.9 MJ/kg and the efficiency factor is 80%.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of egg coal (hard coal supply mix).

This activity ends with produced heat at the hard coal industrial furnace with 1 MJ of egg coal (hard coal supply mix). The dataset includes transport, all requirements for the combustion process as well as all emissions to air and the ash disposal. The dataset doesn’t include emissions to water.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average technology installed in early 1990s. The stoker-boiler furnace is used as reference technology. The efficiency factor of an industrial hard coal furnace is between 84% and 90%. Taking into account the less favorable part-load behavior and the losses through storage, a net efficiency of 80% is assumed.;Reference:;DGMK-Arbeitskreis (1992) Ansatzpunkte und Potentiale zur Minderung des Treibhauseffektes aus Sicht der fossilen Energieträger. Hamburg.;Fritsche U., Rausch L., Simon K.-H. (1989) Umweltwirkungsanalyse von Energiesystemen: Gesamt-Emissions-Modell Integrierter Systeme (GEMIS). Darmstadt/Kassel, Deutschland.;Jensch W. (1988) Vergleich von Energiesystemen unterschiedlicher Zentralisierung. IfE-Schriftenreihe Heft 22, München.;Menke C., Leithner R. (1990) Auswirkung der Energieversorgung auf die Luftqualität in der Region Braunschweig. In: BWK, Band 42, Nr.7/8, s.446-456.;Braun H., Angrüner B., Ecker P., Gschaider R., Sorger A., Wurst F., Ellinger R. (1991) Emissionen bei der Verbrennung. Wien.;Ratajczak E.-A. (1987) Emissionsmessungen an kohlegefeuerten Hausbrandfeuerstätten, insbesondere im Hinblick auf gesundheitsgefährdende Abgasbestandteile. Band 1-3, Im Auftrag des UBA Berlin, Essen.

flow.name: heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=PL
Estimation. Stoker-boiler furnaces emit between 300kg and 1000kg of particles per TJin if there is no particle separation. With an average of 650kg per TJin, 600kg of fly ash and 2300kg of bottom ash occurs. It is assumed that 100% of the ash is disposed (worst-case-scenario). In individual cases a 100% recycling rate is possible as well.
Amount was scaled to the amount of reference product.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. As there is no module for egg coal, the hard coal supply mix is assumed. The caloric value is 28.9 MJ/kg, the bulk density is 720-800 kg/m3, the water content is 8.7% and the ash content is 7.5%. Further values are 73.2% of carbonate, 0.8% of nitrogen, 0.8% of sulfur, 0.15% of chlorine, 0.005% of flour. 

Further references:
Fritsche U., Matthes F.C. (1992) Analyse von Datenbasen zu klimarelevanten Emissionen in der Bundesrepublik Deutschland. Berlin/Darmstadt/Freiburg.
Ruhrkohlen Handbuch (1987) Verlag Glückauf GmbH, 7. Auflage, Essen.
Amount was scaled to the amount of reference product.
EcoSpold01Location=UCTE

exchanges.description:
Estimation. To estimate the electricity consumption, data of the heating plant in Bern is evaluated. At full load 1.13% of the input energy is consumed as electricity. The installed capacity in auxiliary units is divided into induced draft fan (31%), primary air fan (13%), feed pump (39%), electric filter (11.8%), rust (0.8%), feeding (1.8%), slag chain (0.2%), oil supply control (0.9%) and secondary air (1.4%). It is assumed that the electricity consumption increases through part load operation. Additionally it must be considered that the observed heating plant has a capacity of about 38 MW. Therefore, it is assumed that 1.5% of the input energy is consumed as electricity.
Amount was scaled to the amount of reference product.
EcoSpold01Location=UCTE

Amount was scaled to the amount of reference product.

flow.name: Acetylene
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
Estimation. As there is no module for egg coal, the hard coal supply mix is assumed. The caloric value is 28.9 MJ/kg, the bulk density is 720-800 kg/m3, the water content is 8.7% and the ash content is 7.5%. Further values are 73.2% of carbonate, 0.8% of nitrogen, 0.8% of sulfur, 0.15% of chlorine, 0.005% of flour. 

Further references:
Fritsche U., Matthes F.C. (1992) Analyse von Datenbasen zu klimarelevanten Emissionen in der Bundesrepublik Deutschland. Berlin/Darmstadt/Freiburg.
Ruhrkohlen Handbuch (1987) Verlag Glückauf GmbH, 7. Auflage, Essen.
Amount was scaled to the amount of reference product.
EcoSpold01Location=UCTE

flow.name: Zinc II
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation. It is assumed that 2% of the feed water is additionally required as decarbonised water (6t per TJin). For wet purification 1.5t per TJin of water is needed. Due to the lack of information the water used for cleaning can not be considered.
Amount was scaled to the amount of reference product.
